main event: A UFO sighting report from Martha's Vineyard, Mass. on 7 August 1953 describes the observation of three round white lights with the apparent size of the moon, remaining stationary and then veering downward until lost to sight in haze.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes with no perceptible speed or sound, but the lights changed position over time.
A thorough investigation was requested, stressing the possibility that the objects could have been astronomical, and involving local astronomers.
The report includes an interrogation of witnesses who were positive that the observed lights were not stars nor meteors, denying the possibility due to their 'searchlight' appearance.
The observed lights were not present approximately two and a half hours later, indicating a temporary nature of the phenomenon.
The report was declassified after 12 years, in accordance with DOD DIR 5200.10.
sighted object: three round white lights with the apparent size of the moon
